question: What are the English language proficiency requirements for the cybersecurity diploma?
answer: Applicants need to provide a valid score from one of the following tests: AUB-EN (minimum score 32, valid for 1 year), TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80, valid for 2 years), IELTS Academic (minimum score 6.5, valid for 2 years), or Duolingo (minimum score 120, valid for 2 years). Important Note: Applicants who graduated from a university where English is the primary language of instruction may be exempted from this requirement.

question: Do I need a cybersecurity background to enroll in the diploma?
answer: Yes, applicants will need to have a basic knowledge of IT and programming, with proficiency in at least one programming language. Any programming language is considered appropriate.

question: How are the courses structured and timed?
answer: The courses consist of pre-recorded lectures that you can watch at your own pace. Additionally, there is one online live interactive session per course each week to engage with instructors and peers. All live sessions are recorded in case you cannot attend. You can also get support through virtual lab sessions for course assignments and from teaching assistants during virtual office hours.

question: What are the available methods of payment?
answer: You can settle tuition fees using one of two methods: 1. Pay Online, where you will receive an online payment gateway link. 2. Pay by cash at AUB, in which case we will issue an invoice for you to provide at the cashier's office.

question: What do I receive when I complete the professional diploma?
answer: Upon successful completion of the program, you will receive a professional diploma certificate. This certificate is issued by the Maroun Semaan Faculty of Engineering and Architecture (MSFEA) and is signed by the Faculty Dean and the MSFEA Online Director.

question: Does the diploma certificate say that the program is online?
answer: No, the diploma does not explicitly state 'online'. All our programs are offered by AUB faculty members in collaboration with industry experts, utilizing advanced tools and technology for high-quality online learning.

question: Is there an expiry date for the diploma?
answer: No, the diploma does not have an expiry date.

question: Are there any scholarships or financial aid opportunities available?
answer: Currently, there are no financial aid or scholarship offers for online programs. However, you can benefit from an 'Early Bird' discount of 10% by paying the full tuition fee before the start of the program.

question: What is the deadline for a refund?
answer: Refunds are only allowed within 7 days of the course start date. This period allows you to assess the course content and determine if the program is a good fit for you.

question: What is the minimum passing grade required to receive the diploma?
answer: The minimum passing grade for the courses within this diploma is 70, which corresponds to a C+.

question: What is the value of a professional diploma from AUB?
answer: Our professional diplomas are valuable for two main reasons. First, they focus on upskilling you in high-demand areas and equipping you with practical skills and knowledge for the job market. Second, they have an academic bearing, which means you may be able to waive up to six credits if you later decide to enroll in a relevant master's degree at AUB.

question: What are the English language proficiency requirements for the AI & Data Science diploma?
answer: Applicants need to provide a valid score from one of the following tests: AUB-EN (minimum score 32, valid for 1 year), TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80, valid for 2 years), IELTS Academic (minimum score 6.5, valid for 2 years), or Duolingo (minimum score 120, valid for 2 years). Note that applicants who graduated from a university where English is the primary language of instruction may be exempt.

question: What is the course schedule like for the AI & Data Science diploma?
answer: The courses consist of pre-recorded lectures that you can access at your convenience, though you must still follow regular deadlines. Each course includes one weekly online live interactive session with instructors and students. All live sessions are recorded for later viewing. There is also an opportunity for an optional site visit for hands-on learning from real-world projects.

question: What is the typical class profile for online certificates?
answer: While class profiles vary by cohort, our online certificates generally attract a highly diverse audience in terms of professional experience, industry, and geography. This leads to a very rich peer learning and networking experience.

question: Can I enroll in the AI & DS online diploma program without a bachelor's degree?
answer: No, to enroll in the AI & DS online diploma, a bachelor's degree is required as it is a postgraduate program. However, if you do not have a bachelor's degree, you can take the courses individually (à la carte) and will receive a certificate of completion for each completed course.

question: How do I know if I need to take prerequisite courses for the AI & DS diploma?
answer: A committee decides if an applicant needs foundational courses. Applicants from relevant majors like computer science or engineering are usually waived, unless they graduated a while ago and need a refresher. Applicants from other majors will most likely need to take prerequisites. It is best to apply as early as possible for a clear determination.

question: Can I take the preparatory courses and the core courses at the same time?
answer: No, prerequisites must be completed 2 weeks before the core courses begin. All prerequisite courses are fully self-paced and can be taken at any time. Students get access to core courses only after successfully passing the prerequisites with a grade of 70 (C+) or higher.

question: What is the minimum passing grade required for the professional graduate diploma?
answer: The minimum passing grade for the courses within this diploma is 70, which corresponds to a C+.

question: What payment methods are accepted?
answer: You can pay either online via a payment gateway link or by cash at the AUB cashier's office, for which an invoice will be provided. Please note that payments must be made in USD and corporate tuition rates are available.

question: What is the refund deadline?
answer: Refunds are only allowed within seven days of the course's start date. This period allows you to assess the course content and determine if the program is a good fit.

question: Are there any scholarships or financial aid opportunities?
answer: Currently, there are no financial aid or scholarship offers for online programs. However, you can receive a 10% deduction by taking advantage of the early bird seat and paying the full tuition fee before the program starts.

question: What certificate do I get when I complete the AI & DS diploma?
answer: Upon program completion, you will receive a professional diploma issued by the Maroun Semaan Faculty of Engineering and Architecture (MSFEA), signed by the Dean of MSFEA and the Director of the Abdulla al Ghurair Hub for Digital Teaching and Learning.

question: What type of certificate will I receive and how?
answer: You will receive a digital copy of your diploma, which can be shared or used on your resume and LinkedIn. The digital copy is sent approximately two weeks after the program ends. If you request a hard copy, it takes an additional week to issue and can be either shipped to you or picked up at AUB.

question: Will the diploma certificate state that the program is 'online'?
answer: No, the diploma does not explicitly state 'online'. All programs are offered by AUB faculty in collaboration with industry experts, ensuring a high-quality education using advanced online tools.

question: Does the diploma have an expiry date?
answer: No, the diploma does not have an expiry date.

question: How long will I have access to the course learning materials?
answer: Your access to the online learning platform and course content will remain for 12 months following the program's end date.

question: What is the value of AUB's professional diplomas?
answer: The diplomas are valuable for upskilling in high-demand fields and equipping you with practical knowledge. They also have an academic bearing, meaning you may be able to waive up to six credits if you decide to enroll in a relevant master's degree at AUB later.

question: What are the English language proficiency requirements for the diplomas?
answer: Applicants need to provide a valid score from one of the following tests: AUB-EN (minimum score 32, valid for 1 year), TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80, valid for 2 years), IELTS Academic (minimum score 6.5, valid for 2 years), or Duolingo (minimum score 120, valid for 2 years). Applicants who graduated from a university where English is the primary language of instruction may be exempt.

question: Can I take the PMP course à la carte?
answer: Yes, you can take the PMP course as an individual à la carte course or as one of the elective courses within the diploma.

question: What is the course schedule like?
answer: The courses are composed of pre-recorded lectures for self-paced learning, but you must follow regular deadlines. Each course also has one live online interactive session per week with instructors and peers, which are recorded for later viewing. An optional site visit is also available for hands-on learning.

question: What is the typical class profile?
answer: Class profiles vary, but our online certificates generally attract a diverse group of students in terms of professional experience, industry, and geography, which fosters a rich peer learning and networking environment.

question: How many courses are required to complete the Project Management diploma?
answer: To complete the diploma, you need to take 2 core courses and 4 elective courses.

question: Can I enroll in the PM online diploma program without a bachelor's degree?
answer: A bachelor's degree is required to enroll in the PM online diploma program. If you do not have a bachelor's, you can take the courses individually (à la carte) and receive a certificate of completion for each one. No foundational courses are required for the PM diploma.

question: What is the minimum passing grade for the diploma?
answer: The minimum passing grade for courses within this diploma is 70 (C+).

question: What is the cost of the Project Management diploma?
answer: The full Project Management diploma costs $3600. Individual courses are $600, and each credit is $300.

question: Are there any discounts or financial aid for the Project Management diploma?
answer: While there are no general scholarships, there is a 10% discount for early bird payment. AUB alumni and members of the Lebanese Army are eligible for a 15% discount.

question: What are the available payment methods?
answer: You can pay online through a payment gateway link or by cash at the AUB cashier's office. Corporate tuition rates are also available; please schedule a call for more information.

question: What is the refund policy?
answer: Refunds are permitted only within the first seven days of the course's start date, allowing you to assess if the program is a good fit.

answer: Upon completion, you will receive a professional diploma issued by the Maroun Semaan Faculty of Engineering and Architecture (MSFEA), signed by the Dean and relevant Director. You will receive a digital copy approximately two weeks after grading is complete, and a hard copy can be issued upon request.

question: How long will I have access to the learning materials?
answer: You will have access to the online learning platform and course content for 12 months after the program's end date.

answer: Our professional diplomas focus on upskilling you in high-demand job market areas with practical skills. They also carry an academic bearing, which may allow you to waive up to six credits if you enroll in a relevant master's degree at AUB in the future.

question: What are the English language proficiency requirements for the UX/UI diploma?
answer: To prove English proficiency, applicants must submit a valid score from one of these tests: AUB-EN (minimum score 32, valid for 1 year), TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80, valid for 2 years), IELTS Academic (minimum score 6.5, valid for 2 years), or Duolingo (minimum score 120, valid for 2 years). An exemption is possible for graduates of universities where English is the primary language of instruction.

question: Do I need a design background to enroll in the UX/UI certificate?
answer: No, a design background is not required. You can take our one-credit prerequisite course, 'Design Principles / UI Design for Non-designers,' to learn the main principles and best practices of design. Completing this prerequisite will prepare you to start the UX/UI program.

answer: The courses are made up of pre-recorded lectures that you can access at your convenience. Each course also includes one weekly online live interactive session with instructors and fellow students. All live sessions are recorded in case you are unable to attend.

question: What is the minimum passing grade for the courses to receive the diploma?

question: What is the value of AUB's professional diplomas?
answer: Our professional diplomas are valuable because they help you upskill in high-demand job market areas with practical knowledge. They also have an academic bearing, which might allow you to waive up to six credits if you choose to enroll in a related master's degree at AUB in the future.

question: What are the English language requirements for the online programs?
answer: Applicants must provide evidence of English proficiency by submitting a valid score from one of these tests: AUB-EN (minimum score 32), TOEFL iBT (minimum score 80), IELTS Academic (minimum score 6.5), or Duolingo (minimum score 120). Applicants who graduated from a university where English is the primary language of instruction may be exempt.

question: What will I receive upon completing the program?
answer: Upon program completion, you will receive a professional certificate issued by the Maroun Semaan Faculty of Engineering and Architecture (MSFEA), signed by the Dean and the Director of the Abdulla al Ghurair Hub for Digital Teaching and Learning.

question: Are there any special discounts available besides the early bird offer?
answer: Yes. In addition to the 10% early bird discount, we also offer special corporate discounts for groups of five or more. We encourage you to explore potential company sponsorship options for yourself and your team.

question: How long does a typical program last?
answer: The program generally consists of 4 courses completed over 4 months, with a pace of one course per month.

question: Is the program fully online?
answer: The program offers flexibility. It is primarily delivered fully online through modules and live workshops, but a hybrid format with in-person workshops can be arranged based on demand.

question: What is the learning pace like?
answer: The learning is a blend of self-paced study of weekly online modules and assignments, combined with live, interactive instructor sessions that offer personalized feedback. Each course also has a concluding workshop for practical application.

question: Will I get feedback on my work?
answer: Yes, you will apply what you learn to your ongoing work each week and receive personalized feedback from technical communication experts.

question: How is AI integrated into the program?
answer: The program explores how AI can be used ethically and strategically to streamline communication tasks. This includes learning about AI-enhanced presentation design and AI-powered visual storytelling.

question: Is the program relevant for professionals in the MENA region?
answer: Yes, the program is specifically tailored to address the communication needs of technical professionals in the MENA context, emphasizing cultural and ethical insights relevant to building connections with diverse audiences in the region.

question: How can I learn more about a program or schedule a consultation?
answer: You can schedule a personalized 1-on-1 session with our enrollment coaches. Please refer to the official program page on the AUB website for a link to schedule a session.

question: How do I apply for a program?
answer: You can apply for the program through the official application page, which can be found on the AUB website.
